Lens System¶

class lenses.system.LensSystem(base, sample=None)[source]¶

An object to represent a system of Beryllium lenses

combinations¶

Return a list with all possible lens combinations as determined by the shape`array. Each combination is represented as a :class'.LensArray` object

config_focused_at(z, energy=None)[source]¶

Find the configuration that focuses the beam at a specific beamline coordinate. The function LensArray.focus_displacement() is calculated for each array, the mininimum being treated as the most optimal conifguration.

Parameters:
  • z (float) – The beamline position to focus the lens system at in meters
  • energy (float) – (optional) The energy to evaluate the array at in eV
config_with_spot(z, size, convergent=True, divergent=True, energy=None)[source]¶

Find the configuration with a given spot size and Z position

Parameters:
  • z (float) – The beamline position to create the image at in meters
  • size (float) – The size of the spot in microns
  • convergent (bool) – Allow convergent solutions
  • divergent (bool) – Allow divergent solutions
  • energy (float) – (optional) The energy to evaluate the array at in eV
create_spot(z, size, convergent=True, divergent=True, energy=None)[source]¶

Focus the lenses at a point such that a unfocused image of a specific size is created at a beamline position.

Parameters:
  • z (float) – The beamline position to create the image at in meters
  • size (float) – The size of the spot in microns
  • convergent (bool) – Allow convergent solutions
  • divergent (bool) – Allow divergent solutions
  • energy (float) – (optional) The energy to evaluate the array at in eV
focus_at(z, energy=None)[source]¶

Focus the lenses at a beamline position.

This uses the config_focused_at() to determine the most suitable lens configuration for the requested focus which is then applied.

Parameters:
  • z (float) – The beamline position to focus the lens system at in meters
  • energy (float) – (optional) The energy to evaluate the array at in eV
shape¶

Return the shape of the lens array

The shape is determined by sorting the leneses in the system by beamline position. If multiple lenses are found with identical coordinates, they are assumed to belong to a lens stack and therefore their in posiitons are assumed to be mutually exclusive. The None values are place holders for the option of removing the lens from the beam path.
